head.title: Credit Offerings Planned During the Week

hedline.hl1: Credit Offerings Planned During the Week

block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills.

By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 5.95 percent, and a six-month bill was 5.92 percent. The following taxable and tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills.

By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 5.95 percent, and a six-month bill was 5.92 percent. The following taxable and tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
TAXABLE ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Boeing Capital, $1.3 billion of global debt securities in two parts, A2/AA-/---. Merrill Lynch and Salomon Smith Barney.
Franchise Finance Corp. of America, $150 million of senior notes due in 2010, Baa2/BBB-/---. Salomon Smith Barney.
Hanson, up to $1 billion of global offering. Goldman, Sachs International.
Procter & Gamble, One billion Eurodollars of global notes, Aa2/AA/---. Deutsche Bank Alex. Brown and Goldman, Sachs.
Source: MCM CorporateWatch
Ratings: Moody's Investors Service/Standard & Poor's/Duff & Phelps Credit.
TAX EXEMPT TUESDAY
Georgia, $266.1 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
Nashua, N.H., $67.2 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
New York City, $75 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
Washington-2001A, $279.5 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
California Infrastructure Economic Development Bank, $108 million of debt securities for Asian Art Museum of San Francisco. J. P. Morgaon Securities.
Erie Tobacco, $236 million of senior bonds and $44 million of subordinated bonds. Bear, Stearns.
Kentucky Economic Development Finance Authority Health System, $447 million of revenue bonds for Norton Healthcare. Salomon Smith Barney.
Kentucky Housing, $70 million of debt securities. Merrill Lynch.
National Gypsum Company Project Hillsborough County, $87 million of debt securities for Florida Industrial Development Authority. Morgan Stanley Dean Witter.
New York City, $400 million of general obligation bonds. Salomon Smith Barney.
Radford Courts Properties, $51 million of student housing revenue bonds for A 63-20 corporation in Washington affiliated with University of Washington. Lehman Bros.
